author: Staff Reporter
title: Kerala Blog Express flagged off
text:
March 20, 2017 21:24   21:24 IST more-in Travel writers from 29 countries to visit tourism destinations 
Thirty online travel writers will visit various Kerala destinations during the next two weeks and share their experiences with a global audience, as they take part in Kerala Tourism’s Kerala Blog Express (KBE) initiative. 
Tourism Minister Kadakampally Surendran flagged off the campaign at Bolgatty Palace in Ernakulam on Monday. “They will traverse hills, beaches, backwaters and experience life in villages and cities as part of the award-winning promotional campaign of Kerala Tourism,” said an official release. 
The bloggers, from 29 countries spread over all the continents, were selected through a voting process, which saw 38,000 votes being cast online. 
Apart from travel writers from the U.K., Germany, Italy and Spain, those from other parts of Europe such as Moldova and Gibraltar are also taking part. The only Indian in the group is Dipanshu Goyal from New Delhi and the most experienced blogger is Carla Mota from Portugal who has visited 82 countries over the years. Most of the bloggers are visiting India for the first time. 
KBE was piloted in 2014 as a social media campaign, familiarisation trip, bloggers meet and road trip rolled into one, with the aim of creating a pool of global brand ambassadors who have experienced Kerala at close quarters and have the ability to reach out to aspiring international travellers. 
It has received more than 5,300 entries over the past four years and continues to grow in popularity. The campaign itself has set new benchmarks in destination marketing. The third edition of Kerala Blog Express 3 last year won the Bronze for Social Media (Outreach) at the prestigious ABBY Awards 2016. 
It generated more than 9,000 tweets, over 300,000 website visits, over 2,000 Instagram pictures and more than 100 blog articles. Kerala, as a travel destination, was covered on the Czech national radio, Polish radio, Bulgarian radio and TV show, and local newspapers in New Zealand and Italy. 
Kerala Blog Express 4 will travel through Alleppey, Kumarakom, Thekkady, Munnar, Thrissur, Kozhikode, Wayanad, Kannur and Kasaragod before completing its journey on April 3 in Thiruvananthapuram, where the guests will be given a grand farewell by the Tourism Department.
